message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV. 

This paper is about improving aggregated search, which is a subfield of information retrieval (IR) that deals with constructing search result pages (SERPs) from various sources. Therefore, cs.IR is the most likely sub-category. The paper proposes a model that uses a recurrent neural network (RNN) with an attention mechanism to encode the context of the query, and incorporates this information into module embeddings. This involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques, which suggests that cs.CL is also a likely sub-category. The paper also mentions that the model is jointly optimized under the Markov decision process (MDP) formulation, which involves reinforcement learning (RL) techniques. Therefore, cs.LG and cs.AI are also likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper mentions that the proposed model is evaluated on two public datasets that include image and video modules, which suggests that cs.CV is a less likely but still possible sub-category.
